sentence.Network_en: He reportedly called her "a lying little twit".
sentence.Network_cn: 据说他称她是“满嘴谎话的可恶白痴”。

sentence.Network_en: Between you and me I think that new supervisor is a twit.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们私下说,我认为新来的主管人是一个傻瓜.
他是个自高自大的笨蛋!

you fool! 你这蠢驴！you twit! 你这白痴！you bastard！你这杂种！

derivation.yuyuan_name: 1930s (earlier dialect, in the sense 'talebearer'): perhaps from twit
Old English ætwītan 'reproach with', from æt 'at' + wītan 'to blame'

entry.def: If you call someone as a twit, you are insulting them and saying that they are silly or stupid.

means.word_mean: 1. someone who is regarded as contemptible
2. aggravation by deriding or mocking or criticizing
1. harass with persistent criticism or carping;

sentences.sentence: "Don't ride me so hard over my failure"
"His fellow workers razzed him when he wore a jacket and tie"

auth_sentence.content: Darwin emerges as a cross between twit and geek.
